alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 10 at 10:13AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following areas, Coast Range of Northwest Oregon and North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain has ended across the area, with lighter rain showers expected to linger through this afternoon. Area rivers will crest later this morning and are forecasted to remain below flood stage, however the Wilson River near Tillamook may still approach minor flood stage before noon today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast
